lab_metadata.title: Route 53 to Azure DNS: Advanced Domain Management and DNS Resolution
lab_metadata.description: Master advanced DNS patterns by migrating from AWS Route 53 to Azure DNS with sophisticated routing policies, health checks, and hybrid name resolution
prerequisites: Understanding of DNS protocols and record types
Knowledge of health checking and failover concepts
Basic understanding of load balancing concepts
learning_objectives: Migrate AWS Route 53 hosted zones to Azure DNS
Transform Route 53 health checks to Azure Traffic Manager monitoring
Convert Route 53 Resolver rules to Azure DNS Private Resolver
Implement advanced DNS routing policies and traffic management
Set up hybrid DNS resolution for on-premises integration
Configure DNS-based load balancing and failover
Establish DNS security and monitoring best practices

scenario.title: Enterprise DNS Infrastructure Migration
scenario.description: GlobalTech Corporation manages DNS for 50+ domains across multiple business units with complex routing requirements, hybrid cloud integration, and strict availability SLAs. They need to migrate from AWS Route 53 to Azure DNS while maintaining zero downtime and improving global performance.
business_requirements: Zero DNS resolution downtime during migration
Sub-50ms DNS query response times globally
Advanced traffic routing for disaster recovery
Hybrid DNS resolution for on-premises resources
DNS-based load balancing for global applications
Cost optimization for high-volume DNS queries
current_aws_architecture: Route 53 hosted zones for 50+ public domains
Route 53 Resolver for hybrid DNS resolution
target_azure_architecture: Azure DNS for public domain hosting
Private DNS zones for internal name resolution
DNS Private Resolver for hybrid connectivity
Traffic Manager for DNS-based load balancing
Monitor and Log Analytics for DNS telemetry
Azure Front Door for global traffic management

lab_sections.title: Public DNS Migration: Route 53 to Azure DNS
lab_sections.description: Migrate public domain hosting with advanced record management

aws_context.description: Highly available and scalable DNS web service
key_features: Integration with AWS services via alias records

azure_equivalent.description: High-performance DNS hosting service with global anycast network
key_features: Public DNS zones with global distribution
Support for all common DNS record types
Role-based access control and DNS zone delegation
Integration with Azure services via alias records
Private DNS zones for internal name resolution

hands_on_exercises.title: Create Azure DNS Zones and Migrate DNS Records

steps.description: Create public DNS zone for primary domain
steps.aws_context: Similar to creating Route 53 hosted zone
steps.azure_command: az network dns zone create --name globaltech.com --resource-group rg-dns --location global
steps.explanation: Creates globally distributed DNS zone with Azure's anycast network

steps.description: Import existing DNS records from Route 53
steps.aws_context: Equivalent to exporting Route 53 zone file

migration_process.export_route53: aws route53 list-resource-record-sets --hosted-zone-id Z123456789 --output json > route53-records.json
migration_process.convert_format: Transform Route 53 JSON to Azure DNS import format
migration_process.import_azure: az network dns record-set import --zone-name globaltech.com --resource-group rg-dns --file azure-dns-records.txt

steps.explanation: Preserves all existing DNS records during migration

steps.description: Configure Azure service integration with alias records
steps.aws_context: Similar to Route 53 alias records for AWS services

alias_records.name: www.globaltech.com
alias_records.azure_command: az network dns record-set a create --zone-name globaltech.com --resource-group rg-dns --name www --target-resource /subscriptions/{sub}/resourceGroups/rg-apps/providers/Microsoft.Network/applicationGateways/app-gateway

alias_records.name: api.globaltech.com
alias_records.azure_command: az network dns record-set a create --zone-name globaltech.com --resource-group rg-dns --name api --target-resource /subscriptions/{sub}/resourceGroups/rg-api/providers/Microsoft.Network/loadBalancers/api-lb

steps.explanation: Creates dynamic DNS records that automatically update with Azure resource changes

steps.aws_context: Similar to updating nameservers at domain registrar

migration_strategy: Lower TTL values 24 hours before migration
nameserver_migration.rollback_plan: Keep Route 53 zone active for 48 hours as backup

steps.explanation: Ensures smooth transition with minimal DNS propagation delay

validation: Verify Azure DNS zone is created with correct records
Confirm alias records resolve to Azure resources
Test DNS resolution from multiple global locations
Validate all subdomains and services remain accessible

lab_sections.title: Private DNS and Hybrid Resolution: Route 53 Resolver to DNS Private Resolver
lab_sections.description: Implement hybrid DNS resolution for on-premises integration

aws_context.description: DNS resolver for hybrid cloud environments

azure_equivalent.description: Hybrid DNS service for cross-premises name resolution
key_features: Inbound and outbound endpoints for hybrid scenarios
DNS forwarding rules for conditional resolution
Monitoring and diagnostics for DNS queries

hands_on_exercises.title: Configure Hybrid DNS Resolution Infrastructure

steps.description: Create Private DNS zones for internal resources
steps.aws_context: Similar to Route 53 private hosted zones

private_dns_setup.azure_command: az network private-dns zone create --name internal.globaltech.com --resource-group rg-dns
az network private-dns zone create --name dev.globaltech.local --resource-group rg-dns

vnet_links: az network private-dns link vnet create --zone-name internal.globaltech.com --resource-group rg-dns --name prod-vnet-link --virtual-network prod-vnet --registration-enabled true
az network private-dns link vnet create --zone-name dev.globaltech.local --resource-group rg-dns --name dev-vnet-link --virtual-network dev-vnet --registration-enabled true
steps.explanation: Creates isolated DNS namespaces for internal Azure resources

steps.description: Deploy DNS Private Resolver for hybrid connectivity

resolver_deployment.resource_creation: az network dns-resolver create --name globaltech-dns-resolver --resource-group rg-dns --location eastus --virtual-network /subscriptions/{sub}/resourceGroups/rg-networking/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/hub-vnet

inbound_endpoint.purpose: Allow on-premises to query Azure DNS
inbound_endpoint.azure_command: az network dns-resolver inbound-endpoint create --dns-resolver-name globaltech-dns-resolver --resource-group rg-dns --name inbound-endpoint --location eastus --ip-configurations '[{"privateIpAllocationMethod":"Dynamic","subnet":{"id":"/subscriptions/{sub}/resourceGroups/rg-networking/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/hub-vnet/subnets/dns-inbound-subnet"}}]'

outbound_endpoint.purpose: Allow Azure to query on-premises DNS
outbound_endpoint.azure_command: az network dns-resolver outbound-endpoint create --dns-resolver-name globaltech-dns-resolver --resource-group rg-dns --name outbound-endpoint --location eastus --subnet /subscriptions/{sub}/resourceGroups/rg-networking/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/hub-vnet/subnets/dns-outbound-subnet

steps.explanation: Establishes bidirectional DNS resolution between Azure and on-premises

steps.description: Configure DNS forwarding rules for on-premises domains
steps.aws_context: Similar to Route 53 Resolver forwarding rules

forwarding_rules.description: Forward corporate domain queries to on-premises DNS
forwarding_rules.azure_command: az network dns-resolver forwarding-rule create --name corp-domain-rule --dns-forwarding-ruleset-name globaltech-ruleset --resource-group rg-dns --domain-name corp.globaltech.com --forwarding-rule-state Enabled --target-dns-servers '[{"ipAddress":"192.168.1.10","port":53},{"ipAddress":"192.168.1.11","port":53}]'

forwarding_rules.description: Forward manufacturing domain to plant DNS servers
forwarding_rules.azure_command: az network dns-resolver forwarding-rule create --name manufacturing-rule --dns-forwarding-ruleset-name globaltech-ruleset --resource-group rg-dns --domain-name manufacturing.local --forwarding-rule-state Enabled --target-dns-servers '[{"ipAddress":"10.10.1.5","port":53},{"ipAddress":"10.10.1.6","port":53}]'

steps.explanation: Routes specific domain queries to appropriate DNS servers

validation: Verify Private DNS zones resolve correctly from Azure VMs
Confirm DNS Private Resolver endpoints are operational
Test on-premises domain resolution from Azure resources
Validate Azure domain resolution from on-premises systems

lab_sections.title: Advanced DNS Routing: Health Checks and Traffic Management
lab_sections.description: Implement sophisticated DNS-based routing and monitoring

aws_context.description: Health checking and DNS failover service
key_features: HTTP, HTTPS, and TCP health checks
Calculated health checks for complex scenarios

azure_equivalent.description: DNS-based load balancing with endpoint monitoring

hands_on_exercises.title: Configure DNS-Based Load Balancing and Failover

steps.description: Create Traffic Manager profile for primary application
steps.aws_context: Similar to Route 53 health checks with failover routing

traffic_manager_setup.profile_creation: az network traffic-manager profile create --name globaltech-app --resource-group rg-dns --routing-method Performance --unique-dns-name globaltech-app --ttl 30 --monitor-protocol HTTPS --monitor-port 443 --monitor-path /health
traffic_manager_setup.routing_method: Performance-based routing for optimal user experience

steps.explanation: Creates intelligent DNS routing based on endpoint performance

steps.description: Add regional endpoints with health monitoring
steps.aws_context: Equivalent to Route 53 weighted routing with health checks

regional_endpoints.name: primary-east-us
regional_endpoints.azure_command: az network traffic-manager endpoint create --profile-name globaltech-app --resource-group rg-dns --name primary-east-us --type externalEndpoints --target app-eastus.cloudapp.azure.com --endpoint-location 'East US' --priority 1 --weight 100

regional_endpoints.name: secondary-west-europe
regional_endpoints.azure_command: az network traffic-manager endpoint create --profile-name globaltech-app --resource-group rg-dns --name secondary-west-europe --type externalEndpoints --target app-westeurope.cloudapp.azure.com --endpoint-location 'West Europe' --priority 2 --weight 100

regional_endpoints.name: disaster-recovery
regional_endpoints.azure_command: az network traffic-manager endpoint create --profile-name globaltech-app --resource-group rg-dns --name disaster-recovery --type externalEndpoints --target dr.globaltech.com --endpoint-location 'Central US' --priority 3 --weight 100

steps.explanation: Provides automatic failover with geographic optimization

steps.description: Implement nested Traffic Manager profiles for complex routing
steps.aws_context: Similar to calculated health checks in Route 53

parent_profile.name: globaltech-global
parent_profile.purpose: Route users based on geographic location

child_profiles.name: globaltech-europe
child_profiles.purpose: Load balance across European data centers

steps.explanation: Creates sophisticated multi-tier routing for global applications

steps.description: Set up DNS monitoring and alerting
steps.aws_context: Equivalent to CloudWatch alarms for Route 53 health checks

monitoring_setup.log_analytics: az monitor log-analytics workspace create --name globaltech-dns-logs --resource-group rg-dns --location eastus
monitoring_setup.diagnostic_settings: az monitor diagnostic-settings create --name dns-diagnostics --resource /subscriptions/{sub}/resourceGroups/rg-dns/providers/Microsoft.Network/trafficManagerProfiles/globaltech-app --logs '[{"category":"ProbeHealthStatusEvents","enabled":true}]' --workspace globaltech-dns-logs

alert_rules.name: endpoint-down-alert
alert_rules.condition: Traffic Manager endpoint health check failure

alert_rules.name: high-query-volume
alert_rules.condition: DNS query volume exceeds baseline by 200%
alert_rules.action: Scale Traffic Manager and investigate cause

steps.explanation: Provides comprehensive monitoring and proactive alerting

validation: Verify Traffic Manager profile routes traffic correctly
Confirm endpoint health monitoring detects failures
Test geographic routing from different locations
Validate alerts trigger during simulated failures

performance_optimization.aws_equivalent: Route 53 edge locations and resolver caching
performance_optimization.azure_implementation: Azure DNS anycast network with optimized TTL values
benefits: Reduced DNS query volume through intelligent caching
Improved application performance with faster name resolution
performance_optimization.configuration: Optimize TTL values based on change frequency and performance requirements

performance_optimization.azure_implementation: Traffic Manager performance routing with nested profiles
benefits: Improved user experience with intelligent failover
performance_optimization.configuration: Use nested Traffic Manager profiles for multi-tier routing optimization

performance_optimization.azure_implementation: DNS Private Resolver with selective forwarding
performance_optimization.configuration: Configure forwarding rules to minimize cross-network DNS queries

cost_optimization.aws_comparison: Route 53 charges per hosted zone plus query volume
cost_optimization.azure_model: Azure DNS charges per zone plus query volume with bulk discounts
optimization_strategies: Optimize TTL values to reduce query volume
Use Traffic Manager for DNS-based load balancing vs expensive hardware
Monitor query patterns and optimize for cost efficiency

cost_optimization.aws_comparison: Route 53 health checks plus Application Load Balancers
optimization_strategies: Use Traffic Manager for global routing vs regional load balancers
Combine with Azure Front Door for HTTP-specific optimization
Implement smart endpoint selection to reduce costs
Monitor endpoint usage and optimize configuration

practices: Enable DNSSEC for DNS zones where supported
Use private DNS zones for internal resource resolution
Implement DNS filtering and threat protection
Monitor DNS queries for anomalous patterns
Use Azure RBAC for DNS zone management
Implement least privilege access for DNS administrators
Enable audit logging for all DNS zone changes
Use managed identities for automated DNS updates
Secure DNS Private Resolver with network security groups
Use encrypted channels for DNS forwarding where possible
Implement conditional access for DNS management
Regular security reviews of DNS forwarding rules

tasks: Audit all Route 53 hosted zones and record types
Document existing health checks and routing policies
Map on-premises DNS dependencies and forwarding rules
Plan TTL reduction strategy for faster migration
Identify critical services requiring zero-downtime migration
Create Azure DNS zones for all domains
Set up DNS Private Resolver for hybrid scenarios
Configure Traffic Manager profiles for advanced routing
Establish monitoring and alerting infrastructure
Create backup and recovery procedures
Import DNS records from Route 53 to Azure DNS
Configure alias records for Azure service integration
Set up private DNS zones for internal resources
Test DNS resolution from multiple locations
Validate all applications continue to function
Update nameservers at domain registrars
Monitor DNS propagation and query patterns
Optimize TTL values and routing policies
Decommission Route 53 infrastructure after validation
Train operations team on Azure DNS management

symptoms: Domain names not resolving to correct IP addresses
solutions: Verify Azure DNS zone configuration and record syntax
Check nameserver propagation using DNS lookup tools
Review TTL values and caching behavior
Test DNS resolution from multiple geographic locations
Monitor Azure DNS service health and performance metrics

symptoms: Traffic not routing to healthy endpoints
solutions: Review Traffic Manager endpoint configuration and health check settings
Verify endpoint accessibility from Traffic Manager probe locations
Check firewall rules and network security group configurations
Monitor endpoint health status and probe results
Adjust health check intervals and failure thresholds

symptoms: On-premises domains not resolving from Azure
Azure private resources not accessible from on-premises
DNS forwarding rules not working correctly
solutions: Verify DNS Private Resolver configuration and network connectivity
Check forwarding rules and target DNS server accessibility
Review virtual network DNS settings and custom DNS configurations
Test DNS resolution paths using network diagnostics tools
Monitor DNS Private Resolver logs for errors and performance

links: Route 53 to Azure DNS migration guide
DNS best practices for hybrid cloud

next_steps: Implement Azure Front Door for HTTP-specific global routing
Set up Azure Private Link for secure service connectivity
Configure Azure Firewall DNS proxy for enhanced security
Explore Azure Arc for hybrid DNS management
Implement DNS analytics with Azure Monitor and Log Analytics
Set up automated DNS management with Azure DevOps
